abstract: A subsidiary, General Motors Ventures, plans to invest in start-up companies in fields including renewable fuels, information and entertainment systems, and advanced materials.
snippet: A subsidiary, General Motors Ventures, plans to invest in start-up companies in fields including renewable fuels, information and entertainment systems, and advanced materials.
lead_paragraph: General Motors said Friday that it was committing $100 million to form its own venture capital firm as it seeks new technologies that can provide an advantage over competitors, The New York Times’s Nick Bunkley reports from Detroit.

headline.main: G.M. Plans a Technology Venture Firm
